meanings.definition: Make a vibrant or trilling sound, like that of a bird.
meanings.sent1: The birds were chirring happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the crickets chirring softly in the evening.
meanings.sent3: The chirring of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, chirring like a joyful bird.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves chirring in the breeze, creating a peaceful melody.

meanings.sent1: The constant chirring of the cicadas filled the summer air.
meanings.sent2: The chirring of the old fan was a soothing background noise.
meanings.sent3: The chirring of the toy robot made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The chirring of the distant train reminded her of childhood adventures.
meanings.sent5: The chirring of the teapot signaled that the water was ready for tea.
